duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide comprehensive evaluation of psychosocial and mental health status, legal and safety considerations, and transition planning for patients.
Offer crisis management, brief counseling, and planning/coordination of internal and external services across various healthcare settings.
Assess and intervene in behavioral health and addiction issues, end-of-life care, and aid in informed decision making for therapeutic options.
Advocate for patients, surrogates, family members, caregivers, and healthcare providers to ensure holistic care and support.
Educate, facilitate, and lead support or treatment groups to enhance the capacity of people to address their own needs.

education_certification.credential: Master of Social Work degree from an accredited School of Social Work required.
Clinical Social Work Associate (CSWA, working toward LCSW) required in OR. Licensed Social Worker (LSW, working toward LICSW) required in WA.
